title: mx12.levins
author: mx12.levins
created_time: July 22, 2022, 07:44:15 PMLast edit: January 17, 2025, 09:00:55 PM by mx12.levins
content: Hello Bitcointalk community member and Bitcoin art collector I am creating bitcoin art since 2017. This creation of art will speak for itself:) We all know....Availability:1.SOLD (Dustin Xxxxxxxxxx) Loaded with 1,200,000 sats2.SOLD (-) Loaded with 1,200,000 sats3.SOLD (--------------------)4.SOLD (Nauricc) https://mempool.space/address/1HSGETivxdQo2NfqodBdBkNdUDAHDPzUeh5.SOLD (--------------------)6.LOTTERY(open): (https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5470317.0)7.8.9.10.11.12.Pricing:if the price ticker is not loading then update the link BTC=  + (US approx. 90 -120$ Shipping ) + (EU 55$ Shipping) per piece (approx. $950 USD)Payment:Payment address BITCOIN: 36LEhXSiHbW5FewHMMFmiW33XgYGZfNCLFBITCOIN LIGHTNING: nastyrisk78@walletofsatoshi.comBITCOIN LIQUID: VJL6tXznSyRJFBBycJy9Hisy7rtTgQCkcVTBiZrNKvEy54JtjyLWPDT61Lbx9FyrAqCgoqEEtN19oWp QThis collector's edition is a creation by mx12Art, also known as mx12.levins. But what makes this artwork so special? And who is mx12? While no names or faces are revealed, the artist's story begins in 2015, a year of rebirth following a coma. From that moment, mx12 emerged as a fighter, a Bitcoin artist, a bitcoiner battling not just for survival but also for financial freedom. While there's a much larger story behind the scenes about the artist, let's focus on THE ONLY DIAMONDS!Mx12 is an artist who never gives up, regardless of the obstacles faced. The day finally arrived after 5-6 years since the accident to hold a private exhibition in London. This event was a culmination of years of investment, a chance to connect with people and share the story behind the art, to explain why the artist continues to create Bitcoin art with an unstoppable passion. However, tragedy struck as illness struck just before the exhibition. Yet, undeterred - some may say "foolishly" - mx12 still attended the event. But alas, the temperature soared, the heart faltered, and the artist fell. Two to three days in one of London's finest hospitals followed, then two more weeks in Germany. It was during this time that THE ONLY DIAMOND was born, sketched in the hospital and completed at home.The event in London was supposed to be brilliant. Each artwork felt like a diamond in that space. Observing people's interactions with the art on social media felt surreal - you see it, but you can't reach it. Sometimes, even Bitcoin feels like that. That's why it's crucial to safeguard your private keys and passwords, because without them, access to your assets can seem tantalizingly out of reach.——————————————Here's a sneak peek behind the scenes of mx12Art: Each artwork, after that accident, serves as a memory. No art, no memories!——————————————As of now, this listing is being updated as the artwork is halfway to being sold out, with 6 out of 12 pieces remaining.Typically, there's a limitation of 12 artworks in mx12's collection. Two of the artworks are loaded via Opendime with 1,200,000 sats, and one is still open for loading.——————————————Details:Artwork Size: 17x25 inches (44.6x64.6cm)Material: Alu-Dibond-Finart (print is on aluminum)Lamination for protection against moisture, UV light, and scratches12-color printing process for stunning, high-quality results——————————————Until this moment, the artwork includes Satodime, which is similar to Opendime but with additional technology.It offers more vaults and a way to check Bitcoin balance via NFC without needing to destroy the artwork. However, if you wish to claim loaded bitcoins, you must destroy the artwork to access the chip card via USB.About Satodime: It's not just a storage device, it embeds an EAL6+ certified smart chip that acts as a secure element (SE) to handle your keys (public and private) with care.Private keys are strictly sealed within the secure chip, and you don't know the keys until you redeem them. The color of the key slot turns from green to red when it's unsealed.——————————————Here's what collectors have to say about mx12Art: "Finally got this! I love it! Shocked. When you buy something from mx12.levins, you don't just get an amazing rare piece of art and Bitcoin history; you'll also find he's one of the kindest souls out there! Wink ❤️💥👍💯 -🦉——————————————Bitcointalk strong together   ———————Feel Free to visit mx12Art Bitcoin Art Threadhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5362071.0

comments.author: mx12.levins
comments.body: Hello everyone! Attention! Yesterday something happen, we lost bitcoins or I have lose someone else's Bitcoins. Everything was so real and I really don't know what to do in this situation. Please help me. Very hard times as always or I am just person who doesn't have much luck. I will post my inbox and outbox - it was happening very fast, I really even didn't realized there is something wrong with the account, because I had once something like this but I was helping out my friend. Of course the question I am asking myself, why to send to another address? Maybe I should use the same address where it comes from. Everything looks shitty now, that's why I am asking you Bitcointalk community, what should I do in this situation. I feel really bad. If there isn't anything wrong with this account, I will stack some funds and try to send him art on my own costs. It's will take little time but I will do it. I have more art gifted than sold, that's why maybe I should deal with this as well - because I really feel bad and I can't sleep with this. I have really good hurt, much to good.

Screenshots are difficult because I cannot copy/paste the addresses used to check what happened exactly... Sorry for the trouble, and the bs last night... Deleting my post later when I'm allowed ...  If you can post more detailed info, I would be glad to help. Dustin's account looks ok to me at first glance anyhow? Thanks!

comments.author: Dustin westerbeck
comments.body: Someone hacked my account and was sending messages somehow. They even put MX12 to ignore status on my account when they were doing  it. That how I knew something was wrong 😑 I just could not confirm because they were deleting the messages as they went and piggyback on my messages  so I was chasing a gost. I changed my password and account settings, so I believe I am secure. Not that I am trusting my account….

comments.author: mx12.levins
comments.body: Quote from: Dustin westerbeck on July 24, 2022, 11:14:43 PMSomeone hacked my account and was sending messages somehow. They even put MX12 to ignore status on my account when they were doing  it. That how I knew something was wrong 😑 I just could not confirm because they were deleting the messages as they went and piggyback on my messages  so I was chasing a gost. I changed my password and account settings, so I believe I am secure. Not that I am trusting my account….This is something I really hate, I can't imagine steeling from someone, I hate people doing stuff like this. I will send the artwork to Dustin, no matter what. Happy Birthday my brother I don't know how they did it, but I had something like this earlier - maybe you did click on strange link or so. What I have learned myself from this and everyone of course should learn from this - is that if the buyer asks you send the Bitcoin back to him, don't send to another address only the same bitcoin address possible to return. Second is you should contact him via other platform, you don't need to be worried asking - scammer are always getting better and no matter how good you know the person, you should contact buyer via other platform as well if he asks for refund. If the buyer is saying/writing you that he has open escrow with someone than you should contact them and ask if there is an escrow. Please be careful, with love Mx12

I changed my password and account settings, so I believe I am secure. Not that I am trusting my account….I can confirm that, someone message me with Dustin Account and tell me that :Re: (No subject)5oz silver« Sent to: MrCryptHodl on: July 24, 2022, 15:45:34 »Reply with quoteQuote ReplyReply Remove this messageDelete Yes i got hacked, I've just lost 560$ sending a payment to the wrong address fukk Embarrassed  its all i have for this month now im broke i'm not sure what to do now plz can you cancel my order, this forum is not safe for me i guess im an old man .  What caught my eye was the "im an old man" because Dustin follows me on Twitter, and on it's photo you can see that he's not an old man  so I contacted him and he confirmed that it was not him.every time i get a PM from someone wanting a refund, i contact them on another platform if possible, in my case i often go through twitter, and this is the third time i've done this and that it prevents a scam, the same for some of our members, they send me a message on my professional email when someone pretends to be me using a gmail or other!

comments.author: mx12.levins
comments.body: This artwork is truly breathtaking. The intricate details and vibrant colors bring the magic of Bitcoin to life, and the limited edition nature of the series adds a sense of exclusivity and scarcity. The use of Alu-Dibond-Finart Glossy material and glossy lamination ensures that the artwork is protected against moisture, UV light, and scratches, making it a durable and long-lasting addition to any art collection. The 12-color printing process used to create these pieces results in stunning, high-quality results that are sure to impress. Overall, this is an exceptional collection of Bitcoin-themed art that would make a great addition to any collection.

comments.author: mx12.levins
comments.body: I vividly recall sketching this masterpiece – only 7 of these incredible artworks remain. And now, I'm gearing up to bring it to life with an AR animation! 🚀Speaking of sketches, it was an unforgettable week. I had grand plans for the mx12art exhibition in London at the iconic London Whale 🐋. I poured my heart, soul, and resources into it, overcoming challenges and forging ahead with unwavering determination.But fate took a turn. On the event day in London, my body rebelled, and I experienced health issues with some of my organs. I initially ignored it, driven by my commitment to the event. My body's temperature soared for an extended period, leading to my hospitalization. Even the doctors were taken aback.I woke up disoriented, asking if I was still in Israel. It was a frightening experience. Medical intervention worked wonders, and after a week, I was transferred to Germany, where I spent another two weeks under medical care.During my time in the hospital, I found solace in sketching, and the doctors' assistants fell in love with this particular duck. That's when I decided to scan it and complete it. Voilà! Our first duck artwork was born, with a second one in the works. I'm even considering extending this captivating series. 🦆✨Life's twists and turns often lead to unexpected artistry. Stay tuned for more creative adventures! 🎨🌟

comments.author: mx12.levins
comments.body: So guys, another artwork sale thread has been updated with images and a description.This is also an interesting memory, what a time it was! After these crazy and painful two years, I finally managed to do it in London. Thank you to all the supporters. This artwork will always serve as a reminder for all of us, not only for attempting to hold my private exhibition but also for the same feelings we share about Bitcoin. All my art is filled with stories and emotions, especially the most powerful ones - they encompass everything, pain, love, and everything in between.

comments.author: mx12.levins
comments.body: This is how I initially loaded them without any additional information, but I believe they have QR codes and all the details attached to the artwork.  They’re loaded via Opendime. You won’t need to destroy the artwork to access the bitcoins, but once accessed, the artwork will become unloaded.You can see that some artworks have loaded amounts, such as 1,200,000 satoshis, which at today’s price is around $1,156 just for the Bitcoin, plus the value of the artwork itself.Congratulations! Thank you for your trust and belief in me. I was reborn for this! Together, we’re changing the art world, we are free!
